Posts.Content: Joanie wrote: Diagnosed with a mutation of the E-cadherin gene. No reliable screening available.  The option of a total gastrectomy is offered. A lot of risks to the surgery.  Anyone else battling this decision? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: E-cadherin gene mutations Joanie jhoncena1941

Posts.Content: Mar 19, 2008 09:38PM Joanie wrote: For those who are unfamiliar, a mutation of the E-cadherin gene, puts the person at a 40% risk of breast cancer and 82% lifetime chance of getting diffuse gastric cancer which is a condition where cancer grows in the stomach lining and is very difficult to detect.  In a lot of cases it is too far progressed to be treated.  This is why a total gastrectomy is offered as a preventive measure.  Diffuse stomach cancer goes hand in hand with lobular breast cancer.
